meanings.definition: A person who stages or presents a performance or event.
meanings.sent1: The stagers worked hard to set up the stage for the school play.
meanings.sent2: The stagers received a round of applause for their excellent work on the concert.
meanings.sent3: The stagers decided to play a prank by switching the props around on stage.
meanings.sent4: The stagers were like conductors, orchestrating the entire show behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The stagers transformed the empty space into a magical world for the audience.

meanings.definition: Plural form of stager, referring to multiple individuals who stage or present performances or events.
meanings.sent1: The group of stagers collaborated seamlessly to create a stunning production.
meanings.sent2: The stagers gathered backstage, preparing for the grand finale of the event.
meanings.sent3: The stagers joked around, lightening the mood before the big show.
meanings.sent4: The stagers were like artists, painting a vivid picture with their performance.
meanings.sent5: The stagers' dedication shone through in every aspect of the event.
